Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel -definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: guyronen
Reviews.Content: the (very small) hotel is located in a pleasant quarter of old venice, 5 minutes walk from the river-bus and other places, but not in the over-crowded center. staff were very friendly; the room was very large compared to Italian rooms, with an excellent bed and boiling hot water (it was freezing outside). very clean. breakfast was ok, but quite dull. highly recommended for those looking for peace and quiet in the center

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: isnowornever
Reviews.Content: Visited Venice with my daughter last week and stayed at Ca San Rocco. it was a delightful start to our two weeks in Italy. The hotel is very clean and although the rooms are quite small, they were very comfortable. We loved the terrazza where we could sit eating breakfast, although just a tad chilly, the lure of dining under the wisteria won out. Very close to the train and bus station but far enough to feel you were a world away from the hustle and bustle. Easy to find to/from the Rialto bridge too. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful room.”
Reviews.Author: lkdavis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from both the train and bus station. We stayed in the lovely room on the top floor and thoroughly enjoyed the balcony area. It was definitely a good value and a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fdol
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in this charming hotel. It is small and definitely does not have a corporate atmosphere. You will get to know everyone there. The staff were helpful with restaurant suggestions and other helpful hints. The hotel is perfectly located so you have great access to all the best parts of Venice but also with good access to the rail and bus station and therefore the airport. A great base to enjoy Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Comfortable and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Schwabbie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in September. The weather was a lovely 25-26 degrees around this time of year. Our train arrived into Venice at 11pm, so we arrived at the hotel quiet late. We emailed ahead and the reception stayed open for our arrival. Check in was efficient and professional. We stayed in a room on the top floor with a balcony area off it. The room had a double bed and a single. It was very quiet and comfortable. The bathroom was well maintained and clean. We loved having the balcony area. We would sit out there into the late evenings listening to the sounds of the locals play their Italian operatic music into the open air from their houses. The breakfasts were very nice, with plenty of choices. We enjoyed sitting in the outdoor dining area, eating and relaxing as the first stream of bus tours made their way into the old city. The outdoor breakfast area is set up on level 1 under a canopy of trees, so you feel very private as you watch the world wake up and start moving. The hotel location is fantastic. It is about a 10 min walk to St Marks square. This resort has a very strong family run feel, which adds to the warm feel of the place. We thought this hotel was fantastic value and highly recommend it. We have recommended it to friends who have also stayed here. They just loved it too. We will definitely return. **Attend a baroque concert held in one of their churches in the evening. It was divine. Definitely a highlight of out trip. The architecture, the music.. agghhhh memories!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Charming, Quiet, and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TwinkleTravler
Reviews.Content: Celebrating our 15th anniversary in Venice, Ca' San Rocco seemed a good choice from the reviews. The rooms were large and wonderfully clean, and while we were initially concerned that we were not staying right on the main strip, we found the 5 minute walk to the vaporetto easy, and the location was peaceful and charming. Breakfast on the 2nd floor patio was fabulous - covered by a green arbor, wonderful cappuccino, they provide a satisfying breakfast with a good selection of meat, cereal, juices, breads. The two sisters who are the inn keepers are wonderful - when our luggage was delayed they gave us good recommendations on shopping (so we could attend the Opera that night), and once they arrived, they carried our heavy bags up three flights of stairs, and made us feel welcome. Take their advice and try the pizza place just a few streets away - the rotisserie shaved chicken and mushroom pie we had there was the best!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: marknnew
Reviews.Content: Staying here was a great experience and a perfect choice to end our stay in Italy. We stayed here for three nights and it was my favorite of the 4 hotels we stayed in on our trip. It is a quaint, tasteful, smaller, well-kept inn. The 2 women running the hotel were very accomodating. The rooms are a nice size and furnished tastefully. It was great waking up to the smell of couissants baking. I can't say enough nice things about this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Carnivale In Venice February 2011”
Reviews.Author: zenith2
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here during the Carnivale in February last and had a wonderful experience of being looked after very well by Irene and Valentina and their very helpful staff. It is very near bus and train stations, every where is within walking distance Caroline & Noel Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our Expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: KarmaTravels007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Italy for a total of 3 weeks. Our vacation involved a stay at 8 different hotels along the way.....a feat made possible due to the use of a rental car for that entire time period. The Ca' San Rocco was judged by us both to be the best place that we stayed in during our entire trip(hotels included)!!. Although we initially had a small problem finding the place after parking our car in the huge municipal parking garage....when we finally arrived and opened the door to our room we knew instantly that we had made the right choice. Pros: Quiet area...Exceptionally Clean place...Large room...Large bathroom...Great breakfast and cappuccinos....comfortable bed(no rock hard mattress).....soundproof rooms....Great location.....Great value....friendly staff....Would not hesitate in recommending this place to anyone, we both loved it. Cons: None....wished we could have stayed longer! You will also notice that in this area of Venice prices at most stores and restaurants are a lot lower than say in the San Marco area.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Haven in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sydneytraveller689
Reviews.Content: The Ca'San Rocco is located in a quiet residential part of Venice, within walking distance from the train station and also to the ferry which takes you along the Grand Canal to all the major sights. We stayed in the apartment, which had a self contained kitchen and stove - it really was like having your own home in Venice. The breakfast was a mixture of pastries, bread rolls and yogurt. The staff was very friendly and helped us with bookings. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Roy658
Reviews.Content: The location of Ca' San Rocco was first class. Very quiet, yet with easy access to all areas. Top floor suite was very spacious with kitchen area, fridge etc. This room also has a roof terrace overlooking adjacent gardens and giving superb views over the roof tops. The ambiance was fantastic. There is a canal not too far away (on the other side of the garden) but although you can occasional hear the sound of a boat moving along you cannot see anything. Breakfast was very good and taken on the terrace (weather permitting). Very helpful staff. Good value restaurants close by. Would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: traveltravel88
Reviews.Content: We love the location of Ca' San Rocco. It is close to both the train station & Piazzale Roma. But please be aware that you will have to carry your luggage over 2-3 bridges to/from either of the above. Ca' San Rocco is not close to the water so a water taxi would not be an option to get there. This is something to keep in mind if you have a lot of luggage and/or physically challenged. We stayed in the outside apartment. Technically it is still part of the building but it can only be accessed from outside the gate. We were not given keys for the gate so every time we needed to go into the building we had to ring the bell. But it was not a problem as we only went in once a day for breakfast. The apartment was recently renovated so it was modern, spacious and very clean. The was no views from the windows. Although the apartment was next to a small street, we weren't bothered by noise nor people walking past. There was not a lot of traffic and the road was not a main thoroughfare. The breakfast selection was limited but the terrace where we ate more than made up for that! It was quiet and peaceful and offered a great view of the lovely courtyard next door. It was so relaxing sitting there each morning, with those awesome cappuccino in hand, listening to someone in a nearby apartment practicing on the piano. I was a little miffed at checkout when I was told I needed to pay an extra 18 euros (approximate) in new taxes. Apparently this new tax went into effect a few weeks ago but the staff didn't inform us either before or upon our arrival. I wasn't too happy because I explicitly asked and got written confirmation during my last email exchange that the price I was quoted include ALL service and tax charges. Other than that, we were very happy with our stay on this property.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the heart of a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: brooksalexandra
Reviews.Content: Ca' San Rocco is in the heart of the San Polo area of Venice. Nestled in the streets and lanes of Venice where a 'wrong' turn leads to a local restaurant serving locally caught seafood brought from the open air market that runs from Wed-Mon in Rialto. Room was spacious and comfortable with little touches such as complimentary toiletries. Fantastic churches around the B&B which are worth a visit. But ladies cover up your shoulders! Breakfast was simple but enough to fill you up the day ahead. Fresh coffee is also served and my husband and I always had a caffelatte or cappuccino to start the day. In all a wonderful gem of a B&B and a fantastic city. Big thank you to the staff at Ca' San Rocco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Memberger
Reviews.Content: The hotel hast a great location in a central but quite location - great if you are ready to explore Venice by foot. Rooms are clean and spacious, breakfast is great (for Italian standards - but it is not an American breakfast with eggs, beans, etc.). Staff is friendly and helpful, recommendations prooved to be good. Definitely a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with our stay at this hotel suite”
Reviews.Author: Cahir
Reviews.Content: We really had a good experience at the Ca san Rocca. The rooms were spotless and the bathroom excellent. The staff were particularly friendly helping with detailed directions to events. The directions on the site for the hotel, were really good and there was no problem finding it as a result. this is quite a feat given that it's Venice where getting lost is par for the course!! A welcome retreat for the weary traveller and we would stay there again. (Irish couple)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: pugums
Reviews.Content: Nice building and decor, our room had large windows with a view of the treed courtyard opposite which I found to be a welcome aesthetic break from the crowded towering buildings in Venice (garden is not part of this hotel). Very spacious room and bathroom, clean and airy. Breakfast is basic but terrace is nice, again with a treed view. Location is convenient enough, relatively easy walking distance from the train station, a little away from the main sights but that is preferable in terms of crowds. No elevator, so book accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “True gem in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Sienachel
Reviews.Content: So happy I found this treasure of a place to stay at in Venice! Beautiful b&b in a great location (San Polo), lovely decor, clean, rooms are true to pictures on their website... Irene and Valentina are absolutely wonderful! They are so delightful, very helpful and their recommedations things to do, restaurants and gelato are spot on!!! Very close to Ca San Rocco isTarcisio Gelateria that had the best I tasted in Venice...Gelateria Lo Squero in Dorsoduro comes in a close runner!!! Our breakfast at Ca San Rocco were yummy! Rachaele was a delight making sure we got a good start to our day with the breakfast and helping us decide which one on the coffee menu! There was pastries, crossiants, yoghurts, prosciutto, cheeses....very nice terrace to have breakfast on....absolutely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: boopatravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in October. Ca' San Rocco is a lovely small B&B. Our room was a good size with a very comfortable king bed. The attached bathroom was also quite spacious. Everything was immaculate. The inn is located on a lightly traveled street which makes the location very quiet. The included breakfasts were delicious and consist of a variety of pastries, fruit and meat. The breakfast room is well-appointed with beautiful napkins, tablecloths and china. There is a beautiful outdoor eating area also but it was a bit cool when we were there so we didn't sit outside. The location was good. A short walk to the train station and vaporetto a little father to Saint Mark's Square. Being in Venice is like being in a maze, narrow little streets that can suddenly end at a canal. It takes a while to get your bearings but it is very fascinating. We recommend having a good map. When we return to Venice we will definitely stay at Ca' San Rocco.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure”
Reviews.Author: foodgalore
Reviews.Content: We were given a top floor apartment having booked a double bedroom. It was spacious with lovely balcony and view. apartment was cleaned daily to high standard. Breakfast was ' cold' buffet with mainly cold hams/ cheese/ croissants/ rolls was was sufficient to keep you going. Breakfast time could get busy with limited spacing (they had tables at an outside veranda but it was too cold too sit out!) B&B so no facility for dinner/ food out of breakfast time but plenty of restaurants and cafe's nearby. Good location and easy to get to most places ( make allowances for getting utterly lost!) Reception desk available from morning till 9 pm after which it is unmanned. There are about three flights of of stairs to the top floor and no lift. they do have one ground floor apartment. Breakfast is on the first floor. staff were unobtrustive but helpful with whatever you wanted.A special mention to the lady looking after breakfast - obliging and very helpful. Thank you. There' s a locked gate to get into the property, a key for the front door and one for your room so fairly secure. Had a really lovely stay and can definitely recommend it. A pleasurable stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: jrdice
Reviews.Content: My sister, daughter and myself stayed at this inn for four nights. When we got off the train, we had a piece of paper with the directions. Anyone who knows Venice knows that one wrong turn will lead you in a total different direction. We did find the hotel with no problem. It is in a great location. It is owned by two sisters, who were very nice. They served a really nice breakfast every morning. We ate inside, but there was a patio - so they probably serve breakfast out there in the summer. Our room was very nice and clean. There was a little sitting area right outside the front door, and at the end of the day we sat out there with a bottle of wine. There is a locked gate that you have to go through to get in, so it is very secure. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful haven in the most romantic place I know”
Reviews.Author: Travelogger1
Reviews.Content: I must admit that I was surprised to find the Ca' San Rocco closer to the railway staion than I had anticipated, and unnecessarily took longer than I should have to locate it. That said, I found the guest house located in a very peaceful and historic quarter of Venice. I had read some outstanding reviews of the Ca' San Rocco and I must say that they held to be true. I was welcomed by the delightful owner who spoke excellent English and gave me some advice on musical events taking place that weekend; one particular treat I intended to allow myself on this visit. I was shown to my room shortly afterwards. I must say that it was a very spacious double room, elegantly appointed and beautifully decorated. There was a pleasant view of the garden and surroundings from the windows. The bathroom incorporated a bath and a shower. Not something you always get a choice of anywhere you may visit. This too was immaculately presented and well-appointed with all bathroom accessories. I was very impressed with the room alone. I enjoyed breakfast on a patio adjacent to the dining room which overlooked the nearby passgeways. It was absolutely charming with church bells pealing in the background. The range of fare at breakfast also was extremely varied and more than adequate. I really cannot fault the Ca' San Rocco. It really is a haven away from the hurly-burly of the tourist areas of Venice. I thoroughly recommend a stay there to anyone. I will certainly make a return on my next trip to Venice, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and excellent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: FabioEKarin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very charming, very clean, very nice. The location is excellent. The rooms are great. Breaksfast is delicious. The staff is ok, quiet but nice. We definitely recommend this B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: woody666
Reviews.Content: What a surprise to find in Venice, A quaint Hotel, Great Dining Room which Breakfast is served. Total privacy, The hotel has been restored & has been done with great taste. We will definately come back & stay here again. So close to the Train Station. Easy to arrange a water taxi to take you to the Airport from the nearby Soffitel Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: sydneywoman
Reviews.Content: Attractive small hotel next to a garden and off a street with little foot traffic. Walking distance to the sights and the Piazzale Roma (traffic interchange), or the Vaporettto stop is only a short walk. Rooms are clean, light and airy, larger than some major cities and the breakfast is continental. Only negative are the stairs and we were on the second floor. High speed WiFi available.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Calm Amongst the Chaos”
Reviews.Author: KeenBeanScotland
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room and ended up with the top floor apartment with a gorgeous roof terrace all to ourselves. Room was very clean, service was excellent and breakfast was great. As it was warm weather, we were able to sit on the terrace for breakfast. The location was perfect (central but down a very quiet street) and I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good, peaceful location!”
Reviews.Author: Jellona
Reviews.Content: A small and idyllic hotel with a good location. The neighbourhood is not infested with tourists, but one of the main walking routes between the railway/bus station and Rialto Bridge is going just next to the hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious. The breakfast buffet was a bit limited, but all the most important components were included and you was able to eat in on a small cozy terrace. The only bad thing was that I wasn't able to use the wireless internet with my mobile phone (Nokia E71).

Reviews.Title: “Great bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: europe2009
Reviews.Content: Ca' San Rocco was a little hard to find, even with the map kindly supplied by the owners - however, once there the greeting was friendly and the owner sisters provided all the information I needed during my stay. Breakfast on the balcony was a great start to the day and I had a pleasant garden outlook from my room. The room was quite large and the bathroom was clean and well-presented. Only issue for some older travellers is lack of lift, but overall I was most happy with the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “You can't ask for more than this!”
Reviews.Author: narnia61
Reviews.Content: Venice is a great place and accommodations are expensive but The Ca' San Rocco cannot be beat. I paid 100 Euros per night and had an immaculate room that was simple and charming with a view of a picturesque garden, a nice continental breakfast on the terrace each morning, very friendly and helpful service and a very short walk from the bus station in a location that was quiet and safe. What more do you need? This hotel is not located on a canal but Venice is all about walking and water and the walk to the tourist spots from the hotel is just part of the exploring. I probably saw so many more canals and bridges by staying here than if I had stayed at a hotel located on the water. I traveled alone but felt very comfortable the whole time thanks to the friendly service provided by the two sisters who own the Ca' San Rocco, I would certainly stay here again and recommend it to my friends. .

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: KJ-DCG
Reviews.Content: This small B&B was perfectly placed outside the hustle of bustle of Venice's centre, whilst being an easy and quick walk. It was very clean, reception very helpful and friendly and a reasonable price compared to other places in Venice. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh, the bed comfy, bathroom great etc. Internet was available at a reasonable cost. Our bedroom looked out over some gardens and it was beautifully quiet and restful. Nothing was flash or particularly modern, but I would definitely recommend this if you're staying in Venice and want somewhere simple, affordable and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely B&B”
Reviews.Author: traveller0215
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and finding accomodations that were remotely reasonable and nice was a challenge. I am very glad I found this B&B through Tripadvisor. We had a very hard time finding the hotel when we arrived (but then again everything is hard to find in Venice :)) We don't mind being lost but it's not as much fun when you're lugging heavy suitcases up and down endless bridges in your quest to find your hotel. However, once you know where the hotel is it is very easy to find your way back from the main tourist destinations. We found everything to be within walking distance from the hotel but we also enjoy walking. We stayed in a separate apartment off the main building. It had a small but very nice courtyard which would have been lovely if the weather were better. It was also very private and quiet. The bedroom and bathroom were very large by European standards and there was a kitchenette with mini fridge as well. The breakfast was good and the outdoor seating area was fantastic. We got a very good dinner suggestion from the front desk (Au Crevete I believe). I would definitely recommend this B&B to other travellers who are willing to stay a bit off the main tourist route.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet little hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: y_su58
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ca'San Rocco for three nights in May, 2010 and really liked it. It was a 5-10 minutes walk from the train station, with only two bridge crossings. It is located on a very quiet side street overlooking a nice yard (not sure if it belongs to the B&B though). Our room was really clean, spacious, with modern bathroom but the room itself has an antique look which makes it quite charming -- look luck figuring out how to open the windows! Our room even has a small balcony. The staffs were friendly but on the polite and quiet side. I kind of feel bad for the girls sitting at the tiny reception desk down the stair all day long. Our breakfasts were OK. The two days it rained in the morning, all the guests cramped into the tiny dinning area which made it uncomfortable. On the nice day though, the outdoor sitting was lovely. Overall, if you'd like to have a quiet place for the night in Venice away from San Marco, Ca'San Rocco is a nice choice. Our fond memory of staying there, other than the quietness of this little B&B, came from a great restaurant a couple of blocks away, Osteria ae Cravate.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: WhiteTara
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Venice for 25 years now, but usually in the summer. This year I decided to attend Carnivale for the first time. It was enormous fun to see the costumed Venetians and enjoy the spirit of the event.... but what made it perfect, was returning each night to this quiet, slightly out of the way, bed and breakfast. Absolutely no problems here. The most wonderful thing about it was the quiet ... after all that frantic activity outside to return to a room that was large, clean, well appointed and utterly quiet was wonderful. The two sisters who run the B&B speak English and were very helpful to me when my flight was cancelled ... I went right back from the airport and they took me in again. My room was overlooking a lovely garden area, that was green even in February, but the little street outside the wall of the garden was seldom traveled. They give a good directional map, and it is close to both the rail station and Piazzale Roma, a big boon if you are a single traveler like myself with bags to schlepp. Bravo.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly, clean and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: seabreeze1053
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in October 2009 and made our decision to reserve a room here largely on the comments from the past year of Trip Advisor reviews for this hotel. The positive reviews of Ca' San Rocco were spot on. We took the airport bus to the Venice bus station, and then walked 10-15 minutes with our luggage in tow to the hotel. It was an easy walk - just two bridges. A good map is a must for navigating Venice. (We recommend the Rough Guide map) The hotel is located in a very quiet neighborhood, well lit and safe. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was very clean. The windows have an automated retractable metal shutter that not only serves to block out light when recovering from jetlag, but also does a good job of muffling the many church bells that go off everywhere throughout Venice every hour. The hotel is ten minute's walk from the closest vaporetto station. We found that we used the vaporettos (water bus/taxi) frequently and took a 72-hour pass for our three day stay. There are several small cafes and casual restaurants within five or so minutes of the hotel. The more lively areas are a bit farther walk, but not too far. Breakfast is included in your stay. Some reviewers have commented that breakfast wasn't enough - but we found they provided plenty of food. Breakfast consisted of your choice of coffee made just for you (prepared espresso, cafe latte, machiatto, cafe americano, etc) and juices. There was a selection of canned fruit, yogurts, cereals, croissants, pastries, cheeses, sliced meats, and breads. It was pretty good, if slightly repetitive after three days. Although three night's stay cost $717 (US), it was comparable to other hotels we considered, and we feel got very good value at Ca' San Rocco. We enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss out”
Reviews.Author: tanant
Reviews.Content: I agree with all of the posted reviews. This B&B is lovely, quaint, and on a quiet side street. If you're prefer small, intimate hotels where you get to know the staff (the two sisters who run Ca San Rocco were very helpful, polite, and professional) then stay here. The B&B seemed recently renovated and was very clean with great amenities. Breakfast was also very good - you can either eat inside or on their terrace. I loved this B&B because it really felt as though you're staying in someone's house in a quiet neighborhood. It's a 15 minute walk from the train station and easily accessible to great restaurants and major sites.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay and come back to here anytime”
Reviews.Author: purenz
Reviews.Content: This is a little ripper, close to station just 2bridges to cross. very quiet and secure. We stayed here 2 years ago and I just suddenly remembert this cute hotel/BB in Venice.I allways meant to write a review but forgot.so here you go. I would recommend this cute little place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best small hotels you will find anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Jasarm
Reviews.Content: A charming small hotel located on a quiet side street. About a10 minute walk from the train station. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Defenbaker
Reviews.Content: Short walk from bus terminus. Quiet location, excellent directions. Lovely rooms, beautifully clean. Run by 2 helpful sisters who speak good English. Nice continental breakfast. Two couples - no children in our party.
